Pipe

The main struct to spawn a PIPE node, to be used to spawn a node either within another application or in the browser, through the WebAssembly build.

Functions
new

Creates a new PIPE instance

Parameters
seed

A secret key of an bytes length, equivalent to a private key, keep secret!

connection_capabilities

Defines how the rest of the network can connect to you

node_capabilities

Defines what you as a node can do

Returns

A new PIPE instance

Example

If having an open port!

// Can be BIP 39 Mnemonic, a keyfile, etc. As long as it's origin is secure and the user is made aware it's private info!
let seed = "r4uujahLuOtzxLn4TTwwwtF3eDmftGdQ".as_bytes();
let mut th = Pipe::new(&seed, vec![
    ConnectionCapability {
        connection_type: ConnectionType::IPv4,
        data: server_addr.as_bytes().to_vec()
    }
], vec![
    // Note: ONLY adds these if you are committed to running your node with a 99.9% uptime!
    Capability::Committee,
    Capability::PaidStorage
]);
th.init().await;

Light node (webassembly, phone, etc)

// Can be BIP 39 Mnemonic, a keyfile, etc. As long as it's origin is secure and the user is made aware it's private info!
let seed = "r4uujahLuOtzxLn4TTwwwtF3eDmftGdQ".as_bytes();
let mut th = Pipe::new(&seed, vec![], vec![]);
th.init().await;
init

Starts the final connection to the network, with connecting to the bootstrap nodes first after finding your place in the DISC, ultimately being connected to your neighbours.
